conversation.content: [confused] I keep staring at these numbers and they're not... they're not wrong. [short pause] I ran the audit three times. [shaky voice] Three times, and every single time it comes back to Sarah. [gasp softly] My Sarah. The one who, um... the one who helped me get this job in the first place. [bitter] Twenty dollars here, thirty there, sometimes fifty. [sigh] For six months. Six months! [angry] How do you look someone in the eye every day when you're— [trails off] God, we had lunch together yesterday. [crying while speaking] She asked about my mom's surgery, she offered to help with the bills, and the whole time she was... [pause] I mean, it's not even about the money, really. [upset] It's small amounts, but it's the— [hesitantly] I trusted her with everything. My codes, my passwords, my... [sniffle] What am I supposed to do now? [anxious] Report her? She's got two kids. [frustrated] But if I don't, and someone finds out I knew... [groan] Jesus, Sarah. [very sad] Why would you do this to me? To us? [whispering] I thought we were family.

subject: Your cycle counter audit revealed your best friend has been embezzling small amounts for months
